quoteData.value:
Life is simple as a cosmonaut's breakfast. | Vladimir Burich
In the angle of an elbow inscribed the circle of a head. | Vladimir Burich
You can't prove anything to anyone. | Vladimir Burich
The world will freely offer itself to you to be unmasked. | Vladimir Burich
We were given silence to dwell in. | Vladimir Burich
No snowflake in an avalanche ever feels responsible. | Stanisław Jerzy Lec
Is it progress if a cannibal uses a fork? | Stanisław Jerzy Lec
He who limps is still walking. | Stanisław Jerzy Lec
The greater the dark, the easier to be a star. | Stanisław Jerzy Lec
On the top of each peak you are on the edge of the abyss. | Stanisław Jerzy Lec
He had a clear conscience. Never used it. | Stanisław Jerzy Lec
In a war of ideas it is people who get killed. | Stanisław Jerzy Lec
Even his ignorance is encyclopedic. | Stanisław Jerzy Lec
Don't trust the heart, it wants your blood. | Stanisław Jerzy Lec
All is in the hands of man. Therefore wash them often. | Stanisław Jerzy Lec
When smashing monuments, save the pedestals — they always come in handy. | Stanisław Jerzy Lec
Hay smells different to lovers and horses. | Stanisław Jerzy Lec
An empty envelope that is sealed contains a secret. | Stanisław Jerzy Lec
Everything is illusion. Even that last sentence. | Stanisław Jerzy Lec
Do not expect too much of the end of the world. | Stanisław Jerzy Lec
Youth is the gift of nature, but age is a work of art. | Stanisław Jerzy Lec
The first requisite for immortality is death. | Stanisław Jerzy Lec
You must first have a lot of patience to learn to have patience. | Stanisław Jerzy Lec
The window to the world can be covered by a newspaper. | Stanisław Jerzy Lec
The moment of recognizing your own lack of talent is a flash of genius. | Stanisław Jerzy Lec
The shortest path between two points is unfinished. | Stanisław Jerzy Lec
We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars. | Oscar Wilde
Be yourself; everyone else is already taken. | Oscar Wilde
The only way to get rid of a temptation is to yield to it. | Oscar Wilde
I can resist everything except temptation. | Oscar Wilde
To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance. | Oscar Wilde
A cynic is a man who knows the price of everything and the value of nothing. | Oscar Wilde
Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much. | Oscar Wilde
Some cause happiness wherever they go; others whenever they go. | Oscar Wilde
Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone else's opinions. | Oscar Wilde
Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth. | Oscar Wilde
Experience is merely the name men gave to their mistakes. | Oscar Wilde
It is absurd to divide people into good and bad. People are either charming or tedious. | Oscar Wilde
Consistency is the last refuge of the unimaginative. | Oscar Wilde
Everything in moderation, including moderation. | Oscar Wilde
An idea that is not dangerous is unworthy of being called an idea at all. | Oscar Wilde
The only difference between the saint and the sinner is that every saint has a past, and every sinner has a future. | Oscar Wilde
A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us. | Franz Kafka
There are two cardinal sins from which all others derive: impatience and indolence. | Franz Kafka
A cage went in search of a bird. | Franz Kafka
Start with what is right rather than what is acceptable. | Franz Kafka
From a certain point onward there is no longer any turning back. That is the point that must be reached. | Franz Kafka
By believing passionately in something that still does not exist, we create it. | Franz Kafka
Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old. | Franz Kafka
There is a destination but no way there; what we refer to as way is hesitation. | Franz Kafka
In the struggle between yourself and the world, hold the world's coat. | Franz Kafka
The true path is along a rope, not suspended high in the air, but just over the ground. | Franz Kafka
You have power over your mind, not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength. | Marcus Aurelius
The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury. | Marcus Aurelius
The soul becomes dyed with the colour of its thoughts. | Marcus Aurelius
It is not death that a man should fear, but never beginning to live. | Marcus Aurelius
The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts. | Marcus Aurelius
The obstacle is the way. | Marcus Aurelius
Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth. | Marcus Aurelius
How much more damage anger and grief do than the things that cause them. | Marcus Aurelius
He who is brave is free. | Seneca
Sometimes even to live is an act of courage. | Seneca
No man was ever wise by chance. | Seneca
It is quality rather than quantity that matters. | Seneca
Life, if well lived, is long enough. | Seneca
All cruelty springs from weakness. | Seneca
While we are postponing, life speeds by. | Seneca
The greatest remedy for anger is delay. | Seneca
If you wished to be loved, love. | Seneca
We suffer more in imagination than in reality. | Seneca
A gem cannot be polished without friction, nor a man perfected without trials. | Seneca
It is a rough road that leads to the heights of greatness. | Seneca
Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body. | Seneca
Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life. | Seneca
Luck is a matter of preparation meeting opportunity. | Seneca
If one does not know to which port one is sailing, no wind is favorable. | Seneca
Most powerful is he who has himself in his own power. | Seneca
It is not because things are difficult that we do not dare; it is because we do not dare that they are difficult. | Seneca
Wherever there is a human being, there is an opportunity for kindness. | Seneca
Hypocrisy is a tribute which vice pays to virtue. | La Rochefoucauld
Everyone complains of his memory, and no one complains of his judgement. | La Rochefoucauld
It is with true love as it is with ghosts; everyone talks of it, but few have seen it. | La Rochefoucauld
We confess to little faults only to persuade ourselves we have no great ones. | La Rochefoucauld
One cannot answer for his courage when he has never been in danger. | La Rochefoucauld
When we are unable to find tranquility within ourselves, it is useless to seek it elsewhere. | La Rochefoucauld
One is never as unhappy as one thinks, nor as happy as one hopes. | La Rochefoucauld
He who fights with monsters should look to it that he himself does not become a monster. | Friedrich Nietzsche
When you gaze long into an abyss, the abyss also gazes into you. | Friedrich Nietzsche
What is done out of love always takes place beyond good and evil. | Friedrich Nietzsche
Madness is the exception in individuals but the rule in groups. | Friedrich Nietzsche
A man's maturity: to have rediscovered the seriousness he possessed as a child at play. | Friedrich Nietzsche
Not that you lied to me but that I no longer believe you — that is what has distressed me. | Friedrich Nietzsche
Objection, evasion, joyous distrust, and love of irony are signs of health. | Friedrich Nietzsche
The struggle itself towards the heights is enough to fill a man's heart. One must imagine Sisyphus happy. | Albert Camus
The only way to deal with an unfree world is to become so absolutely free that your very existence is an act of rebellion. | Albert Camus
There is not love of life without despair about life. | Albert Camus
Real generosity toward the future lies in giving all to the present. | Albert Camus
Freedom is nothing but a chance to be better. | Albert Camus
Those who do not remember the past are condemned to repeat it. | George Santayana
One cannot step twice in the same river. | Heraclitus
A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step. | Lao Tzu
Wherever you go, go with all your heart. | Confucius
The mind is everything. What you think you become. | Buddha
